model
Class PlayerClock

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      model.PlayerClock
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener
public class PlayerClock
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

The PlayerClock keeps track of how much time a player has left on his game clock. This clock will tick down indefinitely once started. You must acheive the stopping and starting by calling its public methods. This class is mutable (the timer can be stopped and started).

Specification Fields
  • initialSeconds : int // how many seconds it starts with
  • secondsLeft : int // how many seconds it has left now
  • t : Timer // the timer for the class
  • lastSecondsLeft : int // the seconds left the last time the timer started

 void start()
          Starts the timer
 void stop()
          Stops the timer If the timer has run past 0, the timer is reset to 0
